lexUnit.name: come clean.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to tell the whole story

sentence.text: ` So why did n't you just come clean about it ?
The Government has failed to add any convincing arguments to its feeble justifications for the changes , and dares not come clean about the real reasons .
The Government still have not come clean about the information revealed in a Select Committee appendix .
Charity , I should have come clean on that right away .
Mr Salmond also dismissed a call by Labour 's Scottish affairs spokesman , Henry McLeish , to come clean on the extent of the SNP 's deal with the Government .
At this point I will come clean and admit that the cyclists beat the support vehicle to Royston !
Labour will not come clean with its figures , so it is bound to describe ours as jiggery-pokery .
AN ESSEX MP yesterday urged the Prime Minister to come clean about a ` sensational " list of Government services which it is believed he would like to place in private hands .
` Come clean with me , Mister Cowley .
` And when we arrived at Heathrow I came clean , telling them Natasha was seeking asylum . "
He must ask Maud Bailey about the Prowler , yet how could he do so without coming clean in some way -- about his own interest in the matter ?
It was a dignified response if not departure with Spurs chief executive Terry Venables forced to come clean over the Shreeves situation after a media leak .
The vested interests of large corporations will not come clean unless we force them .
BUCKINGHAM Palace still refused to come clean last night on the Di smear letter .
SELLAFIELD finally came clean last night on what happened when plutonium liquid leaked at the heart of the nuclear reprocessing plant .
Do n't duck and weave > Be straight and come clean
Here , talking exclusively to Steve Acteson , Hearn has come clean to laugh at his disasters and the worst decisions of his career .
